intro: Arachnothryx uxpanapensis, commonly known as the Mexican thornapple, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in disturbed soils and along forest edges. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
